column1: Personal data shall be processed lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).
column3: Personal data shall be processed by the processor lawfully, fairly and in a transparent manner in relation to the data subject (‘lawfulness, fairness and transparency’).

column1: Personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes.
column3: Personal data shall be collected for specified, explicit and legitimate purposes by the processor and not further processed in a manner that is incompatible with those purposes by the processor.

column1: further processing for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).
column3: further processing by the processor for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes shall, in accordance with Article 89(1), not be considered by the supervisory authority to be incompatible with the initial purposes (‘purpose limitation’).

column1: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed (‘data minimisation’).
column3: Personal data shall be adequate, relevant and limited to what is necessary in relation to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor (‘data minimisation’).

column1: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.
column3: Personal data shall be accurate and, where necessary, kept up to date.

column1: every reasonable step must be taken to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed, are erased or rectified without delay (‘accuracy’).
column3: every reasonable step must be taken by the supervisory authority to ensure that personal data that are inaccurate, having regard to the purposes for which they are processed by the processor, are erased by the third party or rectified without delay by the third party (‘accuracy’).

column1: Personal data shall be kept in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed.
column3: Personal data shall be kept by the third party in a form which permits identification of data subjects for no longer than is necessary for the purposes for which the personal data are processed by the processor.

column1: personal data may be stored for longer periods insofar as the personal data will be processed solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).
column3: personal data may be stored for longer periods by the third party insofar as the personal data will be processed by the processor solely for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) subject to implementation of the appropriate technical and organisational measures required by this Regulation in order to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject (‘storage limitation’).

column1: Personal data shall be processed in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).
column3: Personal data shall be processed by the processor in a manner that ensures appropriate security of the personal data, including protection against unauthorised or unlawful processing by the processor and against accidental loss, destruction or damage, using appropriate technical or organisational measures (‘integrity and confidentiality’).

column1: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with, paragraph 1 (‘accountability’).
column3: The controller shall be responsible for, and be able to demonstrate compliance with, paragraph 1 (‘accountability’).

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that the data subject has given consent to the processing of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that the data subject has given consent to the processing by the processor of his or her personal data for one or more specific purposes.

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a contract to which the data subject is party or in order to take steps at the request of the data subject prior to entering into a contract.

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for compliance with a legal obligation to which the controller is subject.

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary in order to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person.

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing is necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the performance of a task carried out by the international organisation in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller by the international organisation.

column1: Processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child.
column3: Processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of the legitimate interests pursued by the controller or by a third party by the international organisation, except where such interests are overridden by the interests or fundamental rights and freedoms of the data subject which require protection of personal data, in particular where the data subject is a child.

column1: Point (f) of the first subparagraph shall not apply to processing carried out by public authorities in the performance of their tasks.
column3: Point (f) of the first subparagraph shall not apply to processing by the processor carried out by public authorities in the performance of their tasks.

column1: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provisions to adapt the application of the rules of this Regulation with regard to processing for compliance with points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 by determining more precisely specific requirements for the processing and other measures to ensure lawful and fair processing including for other specific processing situations as provided for in Chapter IX.
column3: Member States may maintain or introduce more specific provisions to adapt the application of the rules of this Regulation with regard to processing by the processor for compliance with points (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 by determining more precisely specific requirements for the processing by the processor and other measures to ensure lawful and fair processing by the processor including for other specific processing by the processor situations as provided for in Chapter IX by the controller.

column1: The basis for the processing referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by Union law.
column3: The basis for the processing by the processor referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by Union law.

column1: The basis for the processing referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by Member State law to which the controller is subject.
column3: The basis for the processing by the processor referred to in point (c) and (e) of paragraph 1 shall be laid down by Member State law to which the controller is subject.

column1: The purpose of the processing shall be determined in that legal basis or, as regards the processing referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller.
column3: The purpose of the processing by the processor shall be determined in that legal basis by the controller or, as regards the processing by the processor referred to in point (e) of paragraph 1, shall be necessary for the performance of a task carried out by the international organisation in the public interest or in the exercise of official authority vested in the controller by the international organisation.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the general conditions governing the lawfulness of processing by the controller.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the general conditions governing the lawfulness of processing by the controller.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the types of data which are subject to the processing.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the types of data which are subject to the processing by the processor.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the data subjects concerned.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the data subjects concerned.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the entities to, and the purposes for which, the personal data may be disclosed.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the entities to, and the purposes for which, the personal data may be disclosed by the recipient.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the purpose limitation.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia the purpose limitation.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia storage periods.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia storage periods.

column1: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia and processing operations and processing procedures, including measures to ensure lawful and fair processing such as those for other specific processing situations as provided for in Chapter IX.
column3: That legal basis may contain specific provisions to adapt the application of rules of this Regulation, inter alia and processing by the processor operations and processing by the processor procedures, including measures to ensure lawful and fair processing by the processor such as those for other specific processing by the processor situations as provided for in Chapter IX by the controller.

column1: The Union or the Member State law shall meet an objective of public interest and be proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued.
column3: The Union or the Member State law shall meet an objective of public interest and be proportionate to the legitimate aim pursued.

column1: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia any link between the purposes for which the personal data have been collected and the purposes of the intended further processing.
column3: Where the processing by the processor for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected by the processor is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose by the processor is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected by the processor, take into account, inter alia any link between the purposes for which the personal data have been collected by the processor and the purposes of the intended further processing by the processor.

column1: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia the context in which the personal data have been collected, in particular regarding the relationship between data subjects and the controller.
column3: Where the processing by the processor for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected by the processor is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose by the processor is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected by the processor, take into account, inter alia the context in which the personal data have been collected by the processor, in particular regarding the relationship between data subjects and the controller.

column1: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia the nature of the personal data, in particular whether special categories of personal data are processed, pursuant to Article 9, or whether personal data related to criminal convictions and offences are processed, pursuant to Article 10.
column3: Where the processing by the processor for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected by the processor is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose by the processor is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected by the processor, take into account, inter alia the nature of the personal data, in particular whether special categories of personal data are processed by the processor, pursuant to Article 9, or whether personal data related to criminal convictions and offences are processed by the processor, pursuant to Article 10.

column1: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia the possible consequences of the intended further processing for data subjects.
column3: Where the processing by the processor for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected by the processor is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose by the processor is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected by the processor, take into account, inter alia the possible consequences of the intended further processing for data subjects by the processor.

column1: Where the processing for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected, take into account, inter alia the existence of appropriate safeguards, which may include encryption or pseudonymisation.
column3: Where the processing by the processor for a purpose other than that for which the personal data have been collected by the processor is not based on the data subject’s consent or on a Union or Member State law which constitutes a necessary and proportionate measure in a democratic society to safeguard the objectives referred to in Article 23(1), the controller shall, in order to ascertain whether processing for another purpose by the processor is compatible with the purpose for which the personal data are initially collected by the processor, take into account, inter alia the existence of appropriate safeguards, which may include encryption or pseudonymisation.

column1: Where processing is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data.
column3: Where processing by the processor is based on consent, the controller shall be able to demonstrate that the data subject has consented to processing of his or her personal data by the processor.

column1: If the data subject's consent is given in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.
column3: If the data subject's consent is given by the personal data in the context of a written declaration which also concerns other matters, the request for consent shall be presented in a manner which is clearly distinguishable from the other matters, in an intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language.

column1: Any part of such a declaration which constitutes an infringement of this Regulation shall not be binding.
column3: Any part of such a declaration which constitutes an infringement of this Regulation shall not be binding.

column1: The data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her consent at any time.
column3: The data subject shall have the right to withdraw his or her consent at any time.

column1: The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.
column3: The withdrawal of consent shall not affect the lawfulness of processing by the processor based on consent before its withdrawal.

column1: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof.
column3: Prior to giving consent, the data subject shall be informed thereof by the supervisory authority.

column1: It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.
column3: It shall be as easy to withdraw as to give consent.

column1: When assessing whether consent is freely given, utmost account shall be taken of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.
column3: When assessing whether consent is freely given by the personal data, utmost account shall be taken by the third party of whether, inter alia, the performance of a contract, including the provision of a service, is conditional on consent to the processing of personal data by the processor that is not necessary for the performance of that contract.

column1: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing of the personal data of a child shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.
column3: Where point (a) of Article 6(1) applies, in relation to the offer of information society services directly to a child, the processing of the personal data of a child by the processor shall be lawful where the child is at least 16 years old.

column1: Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.
column3: Where the child is below the age of 16 years, such processing by the processor shall be lawful only if and to the extent that consent is given by the biometric data or authorised by the third party by the holder of parental responsibility over the child.

column1: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those purposes provided that such lower age is not below 13 years.
column3: Member States may provide by law for a lower age for those purposes provided by the controller that such lower age is not below 13 years.

column1: The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in such cases that consent is given or authorised by the holder of parental responsibility over the child, taking into consideration available technology.
column3: The controller shall make reasonable efforts to verify in such cases that consent is given by the biometric data or authorised by the third party by the holder of parental responsibility over the child, taking into consideration available technology.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not affect the general contract law of Member States such as the rules on the validity, formation or effect of a contract in relation to a child.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not affect the general contract law of Member States such as the rules on the validity, formation or effect of a contract in relation to a child.

column1: Processing of personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person’s sex life or sexual orientation shall be prohibited.
column3: Processing by the processor of personal data revealing racial or ethnic origin, political opinions, religious or philosophical beliefs, or trade union membership, and the processing by the processor of genetic data, biometric data for the purpose of uniquely identifying a natural person, data concerning health or data concerning a natural person’s sex life or sexual orientation shall be prohibited by the third party.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if the data subject has given explicit consent to the processing of those personal data for one or more specified purposes, except where Union or Member State law provide that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the data subject.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if the data subject has given explicit consent to the processing by the processor of those personal data for one or more specified purposes, except where Union or Member State law provide that the prohibition referred to in paragraph 1 may not be lifted by the data subject.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the obligations and exercising specific rights of the controller or of the data subject in the field of employment and social security and social protection law in so far as it is authorised by Union or Member State law or a collective agreement pursuant to Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of carrying out the obligations and exercising specific rights of the controller or of the data subject in the field of employment and social security and social protection law in so far as it is authorised by Union or Member State law or a collective agreement pursuant to Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person where the data subject is physically or legally incapable of giving consent.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary to protect the vital interests of the data subject or of another natural person where the data subject is physically or legally incapable of giving consent.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is carried out in the course of its legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is carried out in the course of its legitimate activities with appropriate safeguards by a foundation, association or any other not-for-profit body with a political, philosophical, religious or trade union aim and on condition that the processing by the processor relates solely to the members or to former members of the body or to persons who have regular contact with it in connection with its purposes and that the personal data are not disclosed outside that body without the consent of the data subjects.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing relates to personal data which are manifestly made public by the data subject.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor relates to personal data which are manifestly made public by the data subject.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or whenever courts are acting in their judicial capacity.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defence of legal claims or whenever courts are acting in their judicial capacity.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of substantial public interest, on the basis of Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for the purposes of preventive or occupational medicine, for the assessment of the working capacity of the employee, medical diagnosis, the provision of health or social care or treatment or the management of health or social care systems and services on the basis of Union or Member State law or pursuant to contract with a health professional and subject to the conditions and safeguards referred to in paragraph 3.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for reasons of public interest in the area of public health, such as protecting against serious cross-border threats to health or ensuring high standards of quality and safety of health care and of medicinal products or medical devices, on the basis of Union or Member State law which provides for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the rights and freedoms of the data subject, in particular professional secrecy.

column1: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.
column3: Paragraph 1 shall not apply if processing by the processor is necessary for archiving purposes in the public interest, scientific or historical research purposes or statistical purposes in accordance with Article 89(1) based on Union or Member State law which shall be proportionate to the aim pursued, respect the essence of the right to data protection and provide for suitable and specific measures to safeguard the fundamental rights and the interests of the data subject.

column1: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed for the purposes referred to in point (h) of paragraph 2 when those data are processed by or under the responsibility of a professional subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies or by another person also subject to an obligation of secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies.
column3: Personal data referred to in paragraph 1 may be processed for the purposes referred to in point (h) of paragraph 2 when those data are processed by the processor by or under the responsibility of a professional subject to the obligation of professional secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies or by another person also subject to an obligation of secrecy under Union or Member State law or rules established by national competent bodies.

column1: Member States may maintain or introduce further conditions, including limitations, with regard to the processing of genetic data, biometric data or data concerning health.
column3: Member States may maintain or introduce further conditions, including limitations, with regard to the processing by the processor of genetic data, biometric data or data concerning health.

column1: Processing of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing is authorised by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.
column3: Processing by the processor of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences or related security measures based on Article 6(1) shall be carried out only under the control of official authority or when the processing by the processor is authorised by the third party by Union or Member State law providing for appropriate safeguards for the rights and freedoms of data subjects.

column1: If the purposes for which a controller processes personal data do not or do no longer require the identification of a data subject by the controller, the controller shall not be obliged to maintain, acquire or process additional information in order to identify the data subject for the sole purpose of complying with this Regulation.
column3: If the purposes for which a controller processes personal data do not or do no longer require the identification of a data subject by the controller, the controller shall not be obliged to maintain, acquire or process additional information in order to identify the data subject for the sole purpose of complying with this Regulation.

column1: Where, in cases referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, the controller is able to demonstrate that it is not in a position to identify the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject accordingly, if possible.
column3: Where, in cases referred to in paragraph 1 of this Article, the controller is able to demonstrate that it is not in a position to identify the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject accordingly, if possible.

column1: The controller shall take appropriate measures to provide any information referred to in Articles 13 and 14 and any communication under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 relating to processing to the data subject in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language, in particular for any information addressed specifically to a child.
column3: The controller shall take appropriate measures to provide any information referred to in Articles 13 and 14 and any communication under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 relating to processing to the data subject in a concise, transparent, intelligible and easily accessible form, using clear and plain language, in particular for any information addressed specifically to a child by the international organisation.

column1: The information shall be provided in writing, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.
column3: The information shall be provided by the controller in writing by the filing system, or by other means, including, where appropriate, by electronic means.

column1: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally, provided that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.
column3: When requested by the data subject, the information may be provided orally by the controller, provided by the controller that the identity of the data subject is proven by other means.

column1: The controller shall facilitate the exercise of data subject rights under Articles 15 to 22.
column3: The controller shall facilitate the exercise of data subject rights under Articles 15 to 22.

column1: In the cases referred to in Article 11(2), the controller shall not refuse to act on the request of the data subject for exercising his or her rights under Articles 15 to 22, unless the controller demonstrates that it is not in a position to identify the data subject.
column3: In the cases referred to in Article 11(2), the controller shall not refuse to act on the request of the data subject for exercising his or her rights under Articles 15 to 22, unless the controller demonstrates that it is not in a position to identify the data subject.

column3: The controller shall provide information on action taken on a request under Articles 15 to 22 by the controller to the data subject without undue delay and in any event within one month of receipt of the request.

column1: That period may be extended by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.
column3: That period may be extended by two further months where necessary, taking into account the complexity and number of the requests.

column3: The controller shall inform the data subject of any such extension within one month of receipt of the request, together with the reasons for the delay.

column1: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.
column3: Where the data subject makes the request by electronic form means, the information shall be provided by electronic means where possible, unless otherwise requested by the data subject.

column1: If the controller does not take action on the request of the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject without delay and at the latest within one month of receipt of the request of the reasons for not taking action and on the possibility of lodging a complaint with a supervisory authority and seeking a judicial remedy.
column3: If the controller does not take action on the request of the data subject, the controller shall inform the data subject without delay and at the latest within one month of receipt of the request of the reasons for not taking action and on the possibility of lodging a complaint with a supervisory authority and seeking a judicial remedy.

column1: Information provided under Articles 13 and 14 and any communication and any actions taken under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 shall be provided free of charge.
column3: Information provided by the controller under Articles 13 and 14 and any communication and any actions taken under Articles 15 to 22 and 34 by the supervisory authority shall be provided by the controller free of charge.

column3: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article by the processor shall not apply to processing by the processor which is occasional, does not include, on a large scale, processing of special categories of data by the processor as referred to in Article 9(1) or processing by the processor of personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences referred to in Article 10, and is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons, taking into account the nature, context, scope and purposes of the processing by the processor.

column1: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article shall not apply to a public authority or body.
column3: The obligation laid down in paragraph 1 of this Article by the supervisory authority shall not apply to a public authority or body.

column1: The representative shall be established in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed in relation to the offering of goods or services to them, or whose behaviour is monitored, are.
column3: The representative shall be established by the supervisory authority in one of the Member States where the data subjects, whose personal data are processed by the processor in relation to the offering of goods or services to them by the third party, or whose behaviour is monitored by the third party, are.

column1: The representative shall be mandated by the controller or processor to be addressed in addition to or instead of the controller or the processor by, in particular, supervisory authorities and data subjects, on all issues related to processing, for the purposes of ensuring compliance with this Regulation.
column3: The representative shall be mandated by the controller or processor to be addressed in addition to or instead of the controller or the processor by, in particular, supervisory authorities and data subjects, on all issues related to processing by the processor, for the purposes of ensuring compliance with this Regulation.

column1: The designation of a representative by the controller or processor shall be without prejudice to legal actions which could be initiated against the controller or the processor themselves.
column3: The designation of a representative by the controller or processor shall be without prejudice to legal actions which could be initiated against the controller or the processor themselves by the third party.

column1: Where processing is to be carried out on behalf of a controller, the controller shall use only processors providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that processing will meet the requirements of this Regulation and ensure the protection of the rights of the data subject.
column3: Where processing by the processor is to be carried out on behalf of a controller by the controller, the controller shall use only processors providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that processing by the processor will meet the requirements of this Regulation and ensure the protection of the rights of the data subject.

column1: The processor shall not engage another processor without prior specific or general written authorisation of the controller.
column3: The processor shall not engage another processor without prior specific or general written authorisation of the controller.

column1: In the case of general written authorisation, the processor shall inform the controller of any intended changes concerning the addition or replacement of other processors, thereby giving the controller the opportunity to object to such changes.
column3: In the case of general written authorisation, the processor shall inform the controller of any intended changes concerning the addition or replacement of other processors, thereby giving the controller the opportunity to object to such changes.

column1: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, that is binding on the processor with regard to the controller and that sets out the subject-matter and duration of the processing, the nature and purpose of the processing, the type of personal data and categories of data subjects and the obligations and rights of the controller.
column3: Processing by a processor shall be governed by a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, that is binding on the processor with regard to the controller and that sets out the subject-matter and duration of the processing by the processor, the nature and purpose of the processing by the processor, the type of personal data and categories of data subjects and the obligations and rights of the controller.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor processes the personal data only on documented instructions from the controller, including with regard to transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law to which the processor is subject; in such a case, the processor shall inform the controller of that legal requirement before processing, unless that law prohibits such information on important grounds of public interest;.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor ensures that persons authorised to process the personal data have committed themselves to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor ensures that persons authorised by the third party to process the personal data have committed themselves to confidentiality or are under an appropriate statutory obligation of confidentiality.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor takes all measures required pursuant to Article 32.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor takes all measures required pursuant to Article 32 by the supervisory authority.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor respects the conditions referred to in paragraphs 2 and 4 for engaging another processor.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor respects the conditions referred to in paragraphs 2 and 4 for engaging another processor.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor taking into account the nature of the processing, assists the controller by appropriate technical and organisational measures, insofar as this is possible, for the fulfilment of the controller’s obligation to respond to requests for exercising the data subject’s rights laid down in Chapter III.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor taking into account the nature of the processing by the processor, assists the controller by appropriate technical and organisational measures, insofar as this is possible, for the fulfilment of the controller’s obligation to respond to requests for exercising the data subject’s rights laid down in Chapter III by the controller.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor assists the controller in ensuring compliance with the obligations pursuant to Articles 32 to 36 taking into account the nature of processing and the information available to the processor.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor assists the controller in ensuring compliance with the obligations pursuant to Articles 32 to 36 taking into account the nature of processing by the processor and the information available to the processor.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor at the choice of the controller, deletes or returns all the personal data to the controller after the end of the provision of services relating to processing, and deletes existing copies unless Union or Member State law requires storage of the personal data.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor at the choice of the controller, deletes or returns all the personal data to the controller after the end of the provision of services relating to processing by the processor, and deletes existing copies unless Union or Member State law requires storage of the personal data.

column1: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor makes available to the controller all information necessary to demonstrate compliance with the obligations laid down in this Article and allow for and contribute to audits, including inspections, conducted by the controller or another auditor mandated by the controller.
column3: That contract or other legal act shall stipulate, in particular, that the processor makes available to the controller all information necessary to demonstrate compliance with the obligations laid down in this Article by the controller and allow for and contribute to audits, including inspections, conducted by the controller or another auditor mandated by the controller.

column1: With regard to point (h) of the first subparagraph, the processor shall immediately inform the controller if, in its opinion, an instruction infringes this Regulation or other Union or Member State data protection provisions.
column3: With regard to point (h) of the first subparagraph, the processor shall immediately inform the controller if, in its opinion, an instruction infringes this Regulation or other Union or Member State data protection provisions.

column1: Where a processor engages another processor for carrying out specific processing activities on behalf of the controller, the same data protection obligations as set out in the contract or other legal act between the controller and the processor as referred to in paragraph 3 shall be imposed on that other processor by way of a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, in particular providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that the processing will meet the requirements of this Regulation.
column3: Where a processor engages another processor for carrying out specific processing by the processor activities on behalf of the controller, the same data protection obligations as set out by the processor in the contract or other legal act between the controller and the processor as referred to in paragraph 3 shall be imposed by the processor on that other processor by way of a contract or other legal act under Union or Member State law, in particular providing sufficient guarantees to implement appropriate technical and organisational measures in such a manner that the processing by the processor will meet the requirements of this Regulation.

column1: Where that other processor fails to fulfil its data protection obligations, the initial processor shall remain fully liable to the controller for the performance of that other processor’s obligations.
column3: Where that other processor fails to fulfil its data protection obligations, the initial processor shall remain fully liable to the controller for the performance of that other processor’s obligations.

column1: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.
column3: Adherence of a processor to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the processor as an element by which to demonstrate sufficient guarantees as referred to in paragraphs 1 and 4 of this Article.

column1: Without prejudice to an individual contract between the controller and the processor, the contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 of this Article may be based, in whole or in part, on standard contractual clauses referred to in paragraphs 7 and 8 of this Article, including when they are part of a certification granted to the controller or processor pursuant to Articles 42 and 43.
column3: Without prejudice to an individual contract between the controller and the processor, the contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 of this Article may be based, in whole or in part, on standard contractual clauses referred to in paragraphs 7 and 8 of this Article, including when they are part of a certification granted by the controller to the controller or processor pursuant to Articles 42 and 43.

column1: The Commission may lay down standard contractual clauses for the matters referred to in paragraph 3 and 4 of this Article and in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 93(2).
column3: The Commission may lay down standard contractual clauses for the matters referred to in paragraph 3 and 4 of this Article and in accordance with the examination procedure referred to in Article 93(2).

column3: A supervisory authority may adopt standard contractual clauses for the matters referred to in paragraph 3 and 4 of this Article and in accordance with the consistency mechanism referred to in Article 63.

column1: The contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 shall be in writing, including in electronic form.
column3: The contract or the other legal act referred to in paragraphs 3 and 4 shall be in writing by the third party, including in electronic form.

column3: Without prejudice to Articles 82, 83 and 84, if a processor infringes this Regulation by determining the purposes and means of processing by the processor, the processor shall be considered by the supervisory authority to be a controller in respect of that processing by the processor.

column1: The processor and any person acting under the authority of the controller or of the processor, who has access to personal data, shall not process those data except on instructions from the controller, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law.
column3: The processor and any person acting under the authority of the controller or of the processor, who has access to personal data, shall not process those data except on instructions from the controller, unless required to do so by Union or Member State law.

column3: Each controller and, where applicable, the controller’s representative, shall maintain a record of processing activities under its responsibility.

column3: That record shall contain the name and contact details of the controller and, where applicable, the joint controller, the controller’s representative and the data protection officer.

column3: That record shall contain the purposes of the processing by the processor.

column1: That record shall contain a description of the categories of data subjects and of the categories of personal data.
column3: That record shall contain a description of the categories of data subjects and of the categories of personal data.

column3: That record shall contain the categories of recipients to whom the personal data have been or will be disclosed including recipients in third countries or international organisations.

column3: That record shall contain where applicable, transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, including the identification of that third country or international organisation and, in the case of transfers referred to in the second subparagraph of Article 49(1), the documentation of suitable safeguards.

column1: That record shall contain where possible, the envisaged time limits for erasure of the different categories of data.
column3: That record shall contain where possible, the envisaged time limits for erasure of the different categories of data.

column1: That record shall contain where possible, a general description of the technical and organisational security measures referred to in Article 32(1).
column3: That record shall contain where possible, a general description of the technical and organisational security measures referred to in Article 32(1).

column1: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing the name and contact details of the processor or processors and of each controller on behalf of which the processor is acting, and, where applicable, of the controller’s or the processor’s representative, and the data protection officer.
column3: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing by the processor activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing the name and contact details of the processor or processors and of each controller on behalf of which the processor is acting, and, where applicable, of the controller’s or the processor’s representative, and the data protection officer.

column1: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing the categories of processing carried out on behalf of each controller.
column3: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing by the processor activities carried out on behalf of a controller by the controller, containing the categories of processing by the processor carried out on behalf of each controller by the processor.

column1: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing where applicable, transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, including the identification of that third country or international organisation and, in the case of transfers referred to in the second subparagraph of Article 49(1), the documentation of suitable safeguards.
column3: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing by the processor activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing where applicable, transfers of personal data to a third country or an international organisation, including the identification of that third country or international organisation and, in the case of transfers referred to in the second subparagraph of Article 49(1), the documentation of suitable safeguards.

column1: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing where possible, a general description of the technical and organisational security measures referred to in Article 32(1).
column3: Each processor and, where applicable, the processor’s representative shall maintain a record of all categories of processing by the processor activities carried out on behalf of a controller, containing where possible, a general description of the technical and organisational security measures referred to in Article 32(1).

column1: The records referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be in writing, including in electronic form.
column3: The records referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall be in writing by the third party, including in electronic form.

column1: The controller or the processor and, where applicable, the controller’s or the processor’s representative, shall make the record available to the supervisory authority on request.
column3: The controller or the processor and, where applicable, the controller’s or the processor’s representative, shall make the record available to the supervisory authority on request.

column1: The obligations referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to an enterprise or an organisation employing fewer than 250 persons unless the processing it carries out is likely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects, the processing is not occasional, or the processing includes special categories of data as referred to in Article 9(1) or personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences referred to in Article 10.
column3: The obligations referred to in paragraphs 1 and 2 shall not apply to an enterprise or an organisation employing fewer than 250 persons unless the processing by the processor it carries out is likely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of data subjects, the processing by the processor is not occasional, or the processing by the processor includes special categories of data as referred to in Article 9(1) or personal data relating to criminal convictions and offences referred to in Article 10.

column1: The controller and the processor and, where applicable, their representatives, shall cooperate, on request, with the supervisory authority in the performance of its tasks.
column3: The controller and the processor and, where applicable, their representatives, shall cooperate, on request, with the supervisory authority in the performance of its tasks.

column1: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the pseudonymisation and encryption of personal data.
column3: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the pseudonymisation and encryption of personal data.

column1: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the ability to ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing systems and services.
column3: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the ability to ensure the ongoing confidentiality, integrity, availability and resilience of processing by the processor systems and services.

column1: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the ability to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.
column3: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate the ability to restore the availability and access to personal data in a timely manner in the event of a physical or technical incident.

column1: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organisational measures for ensuring the security of the processing.
column3: Taking into account the state of the art, the costs of implementation and the nature, scope, context and purposes of processing by the processor as well as the risk of varying likelihood and severity for the rights and freedoms of natural persons, the controller and the processor shall implement appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure a level of security appropriate to the risk, including inter alia as appropriate a process for regularly testing, assessing and evaluating the effectiveness of technical and organisational measures for ensuring the security of the processing by the processor.

column1: In assessing the appropriate level of security account shall be taken in particular of the risks that are presented by processing, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted, stored or otherwise processed.
column3: In assessing the appropriate level of security account shall be taken by the controller in particular of the risks that are presented by processing by the processor, in particular from accidental or unlawful destruction, loss, alteration, unauthorised disclosure of, or access to personal data transmitted by the personal data breach, stored by the processor or otherwise processed by the processor.

column1: Adherence to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article.
column3: Adherence to an approved code of conduct as referred to in Article 40 or an approved certification mechanism as referred to in Article 42 may be used by the processor as an element by which to demonstrate compliance with the requirements set out in paragraph 1 of this Article by the processor.

column1: The controller and processor shall take steps to ensure that any natural person acting under the authority of the controller or the processor who has access to personal data does not process them except on instructions from the controller, unless he or she is required to do so by Union or Member State law.
column3: The controller and processor shall take steps to ensure that any natural person acting under the authority of the controller or the processor who has access to personal data does not process them except on instructions from the controller, unless he or she is required to do so by Union or Member State law by the supervisory authority.

column1: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority competent in accordance with Article 55, unless the personal data breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.
column3: In the case of a personal data breach, the controller shall without undue delay and, where feasible, not later than 72 hours after having become by the information society service aware of it, notify the personal data breach to the supervisory authority competent in accordance with Article 55, unless the personal data breach is unlikely to result in a risk to the rights and freedoms of natural persons.

column1: Where the notification to the supervisory authority is not made within 72 hours, it shall be accompanied by reasons for the delay.
column3: Where the notification to the supervisory authority is not made within 72 hours by the processor, it shall be accompanied by reasons for the delay.

column1: The processor shall notify the controller without undue delay after becoming aware of a personal data breach.
column3: The processor shall notify the controller without undue delay after becoming aware of a personal data breach.

column1: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.
column3: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the nature of the personal data breach including where possible, the categories and approximate number of data subjects concerned and the categories and approximate number of personal data records concerned.

column3: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least communicate the name and contact details of the data protection officer or other contact point where more information can be obtained by the controller.

column3: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the likely consequences of the personal data breach.

column3: The notification referred to in paragraph 1 shall at least describe the measures taken by the controller or proposed by the controller to be taken by the controller to address the personal data breach, including, where appropriate, measures to mitigate its possible adverse effects.

column3: The controller shall document any personal data breaches, comprising the facts relating to the personal data breach, its effects and the remedial action taken.
